title: Gather Requirements and Define Architecture for Backend for Frontend (BFF) Implementation
description:
Understand the project requirements, define the overall architecture for the Backend for Frontend (BFF) pattern implementation. Identify the necessary components and services including: 
1. Data projections required for different UI views
2. Event-driven update mechanisms (specify WebSocket or similar technology)
3. Data caching strategies considering edge cases and performance optimizations (consider Redis or Memcached)
4. API gateway integration for efficient communication with various services (discuss preferred option like NGINX, Kong, or Tyk)
5. Microservices architecture to ensure scalability, maintainability, and modularity
6. Error handling mechanisms for graceful degradation in case of failures (specify error types and proposed mitigation strategies)
7. Consider the use of monitoring and logging tools for debugging and troubleshooting (list potential tools like ELK stack, Prometheus, or Grafana)
8. Document the design decisions and rationale in a technical write-up
9. Assign tasks to frontend-developer and backend-developer team members based on the architecture design.
10. Schedule regular meetings with the team to discuss progress and address any issues.

title: Design Data Projections
description: Define the structure and format of the UI-ready data projections that will be served by the BFF layer.

title: Implement BFF Layer
description: Develop the BFF layer, including APIs, data transformations, and event handling mechanisms.

title: Set up Event-Driven Architecture
description: Implement the event-driven architecture to enable real-time UI updates based on backend events.

title: Integrate with Backend Services
description: Connect the BFF layer with the existing backend services and data sources.

title: Implement UI Components
description: Develop the UI components that will consume the data projections and handle real-time updates.

title: Set up Testing and Deployment Pipelines
description: Establish testing and deployment pipelines for the BFF layer and UI components.

title: Conduct Security Audits
description: Perform security audits on the BFF layer and event-driven architecture to identify and mitigate potential vulnerabilities.

title: Write Documentation
description: Document the BFF layer, data projections, event-driven architecture, and UI components for future reference and maintenance.
